featured.text: Hidden deep in a small alley among various tiny shops, the entrance of the Michelin star restaurant is barely ______ to passersby.

You 16 the mirror to find a tiny red spot on the base of your lower lashes.
When night falls over the Red Sea, tiny flashlight fish rise to the surface for food, each with a pair of “headlamps,” one beneath each eye.

The junk varies from tiny pieces of paint chipped off rockets to cameras, huge fuel tanks, and even odd items like the million-dollar tool kit that astronaut Heidemarie Stefanyshyn-Piper lost during a spacewalk.

other.text: They found that the sick plants could “sneeze” and 23 tiny water drops filled with leaf rust germs, spreading the disease to neighboring plants.
Higher ocean temperatures kill the important food source for the coral—the algae, the tiny greenish-gold water plants that live on coral.
If the research proves successful in humans, some of the nearly 40 million blind people worldwide may one day have a tiny, striped fish to thank. 43.

definition.en_def: Very small in size or amount.
definition.example: The tiny kitten fit in the palm of my hand.
